text: hi everyone is Helen here today and we
making caramel like pork and shrimp
don't eat rim or Tom blimp patchy this
is one of the very popular dishes that
you can buy in your daily Vietnamese
meal is a sweet and savory dish goes
really well with hot steamed rice so I
hope you're gonna like it and let's
begin
firstly slide the potbelly into thin
slices you can also use link pork if you
like smash one stock of green onion
white part only and mince finely season
the pork with some salt and you can
stock the minced green onion stems and
some freshly cracked pepper mix well and
set aside for the shrooms I'm going to
use white shrimps in size 5060 with the
shell on this is one kilogram package
that I bought at the Asian store I'm
going to use the whole package for the
recipe today because after the frosting
I can put it back into the freezer and
the good thing is that each tube tastes
great after a few days so it's going to
be in my lunchbox for the whole next
week you just remove the tip of the head
the tails and the legs and season
lightly with salt and pepper mix well
and set aside for about 10 minutes now
in a large sauce pan or a wok heat one
tablespoon of vegetable oil and fry a
tablespoon of minced shallot or garlic
until fragrant then add the pork and
stir-fry until it's no longer pink you
can do this on high heat when the color
of the pork has turned to hell now we
can add in the shrimps make sure you
turn on a high heat when you add in the
shrooms that way the color of the
shrimps will turn orange really quick
and more beautifully stir really well
then add about 2 to 3 tbsp of sugar as
we continue to cook the shrimps is going
to get caramelized very nicely stir well
for 2 minutes so the shrooms can absorb
the sugar then add infi sauce to your
taste I add about 3 tablespoons remember
to ask for sauce at last that's the
secret to make a good tone bream now
stir well and simmer on medium heat for
about 15 minutes or until the sauce is
completely evaporated
storing occasionally after 15 to 20
minutes you can see that there's no
sauce left and the shrooms and pots are
nicely caramelized to give it a nice
shiny look you can ask some oyster sauce
if you want a more vibrant color you can
add some chili oil or a natural oil
that's it transfer to a serving plate
garnish with some chopped onion if you
like and a lot of freshly cracked pepper
on top the pork and shrooms are
caramelized is sweet and savory is a
perfect side dish to serve with hot
steamed rice you can keep it in the
fridge for a week and it still tastes
great every day if you liked this video
don't forget to click like and subscribe
